definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: The Labour Tribunal handles claims arising from contracts of employment.
sentences.chinese: 勞資審裁處審理有關僱傭合約的申索。

sentences.english: It is not necessary to set up a website in view of the function of the Tribunal.
sentences.chinese: 基於審裁處的功能，沒有需要爲審裁處設立網頁。

sentences.english: It is not necessary to set up a website in view of the function of the Tribunal.
sentences.chinese: 基於審裁處的功能，沒有需要爲審裁處設立網頁。

sentences.english: The division also provides counsel to the Insider Dealing Tribunal.
sentences.chinese: 此外，該科也爲內幕交易審裁處提供律師。

sentences.english: The judge(s) sitting at the Labour Tribunal or the Lands Tribunal.
sentences.chinese: 於勞資審裁處或土地審裁處席前審案的法官。

sentences.english: The judge(s) sitting at the Labour Tribunal or the Lands Tribunal.
sentences.chinese: 於勞資審裁處或土地審裁處席前審案的法官。

sentences.english: The Labour Tribunal hears civil claims arising from contracts of employment.
sentences.chinese: 勞資審裁處審理與僱傭合約有關的民事申索。

definition: to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
to expose (e.g., wrongdoing)/to accuse (in court)/to impeach/to denounce
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to commute a prison sentence to a fine (Tw)
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to bring to justice/to hand over to the law
